y_FVv14nISkwbUgLNVle6Q.text: This is a hidden gem of a seafood restaurant. Had the clam chowder with abundant clam bites and just the right amount of bacon bits. Blackened redfish was cooked and seasoned perfectly complemented by tasty roasted Brussels sprouts. Wife's prosciutto wrapped scallops were the largest I'd ever seen. Service was prompt and attentive. Prices a little more than expected but as the sign there said "fresh fish isn't cheap, cheap fish isn't fresh."

fSwNeCjQuKisovDeJFs5PA.text: So the food was ok the last first time we came.  My oysters were pretty good but my coworker didn't care for his fries or shrimp.  The portion sizes are average and the price is definitely $$.  I'd suggest more food for the amount I'm paying but not a huge deal.  I don't need to be eating that much anyways!!   So I returned today because I had a taste for fried oysters.  Not necessarily their fried oysters, just some fried oysters, and according to Yelp there aren't any other places close to here. They don't serve oysters for lunch!  What?!!  I don't like that.  Comeonguys!  Serve the entire menu for lunch!  If McDonalds can serve breakfast all day y'all can bread some oysters and throw them in the oil during the lunch hours!

eblSTpGkdVjr7qvKjjAN2Q.text: I went to get lunch and purchase some items. I ordered the Fish and Chips for lunch .It was good, but used to the authentic British Fish and Chips. After lunch, I thought I would purchase some seafood at the counter. I wish to inquire more about the products from staff. They answered, but I found them to be offputing and short with me. After, this experience, I won't be visiting again.

9KTFwXS_qHPV3qPdZKjUvw.text: OMG this place is incredible!  Whether you are going to pick out some fish to take home and cook, or sitting down for a meal, this place is awesome!  I love their huge counter containing the fish and seeing the giant slabs of tuna and salmon - I wanted to try all of it!  You can get a wide variety of amazingly fresh cuts of fish, oysters, and clams.  Their food options for lunch/dinner are also on point!  Fish tacos and seared tuna sandwich (which was my favorite) were so delicious!  Each of the menu items comes with a side of potatoes (think thick cut french fries), or slaw and I have enjoyed both!  Cannot go wrong here.

COlORHcaFjEtoHvDU-zLrg.text: I went here 3 years ago and the food was amazing! Came back about a month ago and the fish sandwich was soooo bland and soggy. Fries were also burnt and customer service was absolutely horrible! The gentleman barely spoke and acted like he didn't want to take my order. Definitely will not be back here.

1roMAcalvqmSDvw55qAdYQ.text: Deep Sea Seafood Market, I love you. A whole lot.   This is one of my favorite places in Charlotte. I've never actually bought seafood from here. My affection and obsession are solely based on the amazing lunch menus they crank out every day.  There are some constant items, but the lunch menu changes daily. They post it every day around 10:30am on their website, Facebook, and Twitter. So, make sure to follow them. Lunch is served Monday-Saturday 11am-2pm, Dinner is Tuesday-Saturday 5-8pm.   I've never had a bad meal here. Sandwiches, fish tacos- it's all damn delicious. My absolute favorite is when they do lobster rolls as the special. They are perfection. Warning: if you see it's lobster roll day, go early to make sure you get one before they're all gone. Also, if you go late and they're sold out, don't bitch about it. That's a you problem, not a Deep Sea problem. Seriously, when they post it's lobster roll day, I derail my entire schedule to make sure I can swing by for one.   Seafood counter-wise, the prices seem pretty fare. Remember: you get what you pay for in life. Good, fresh seafood is worth it. You'll always see the same duo working the counter and tables during lunch. They know all the regulars, all the regulars know them. They are great and will put a smile on your face. It's not a huge place. There are a few tables, but your best bet may be to get your food to go during peak lunch time.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster roll day

gf1oOpqndIZQYPwcTVWg1A.text: This was my first and last time at this establishment. The experience was so bad I really wish I could get my money back. I'm not sure if the man at the register was the owner, but his customer service skills are non existent. You are running a business; providing a service to consumers. The least I expect is to be greeted. There was no greeting and he was annoyed at the questions I asked about the menu. There were also signs up around the restaurant telling the patrons how to conduct themselves while dining there, which I thought was very very weird. I ordered the fried flounder sandwich that came with fries. I never thought that it was possible to mess up a fish sandwich but boy was I wrong. The fish was battered in cornmeal that had absolutely no flavor. The piece of fish was also very small that it was over powered by the hoagie that it was on. I barely tasted the fish. I added salt and pepper to the sandwich in hopes it would give it some flavor but that did not help. The fish literally had no taste and I can tell it was unseasoned. I seriously have made better fish sandwiches at home. The fries were decent because they were homemade and cut in the back. The food tasted and looked like the grease it was cooked in needed to be changed; hence the dark/burnt fries. I honestly didn't finish the food and just took this as a loss. I will stick to going to chicken and ribs on Beatties Ford for my fish sandwiches. Never again will I eat here!

WFmbc9pOfkQZhmj6ypmmgg.text: Good, fresh seafood, much of it with a New England flair.  Interior is modest with limited seating.  Food is served quickly.

ihM6-YFtyjzlR8yV-W0hsg.text: We certainly enjoyed the food.  It is a shame they don't have more seating.  I don't know if they had more fresh seafood in the back but their display case was very minimal.

lir2UoiLHt-kv650dtcV5A.text: I've been going to this place close to 2 years.  It's a seafood market so you can buy it and take it home and cook it yourself or you can order lunch and they will cook it up for you. I always get the flounder or catfish po boy but the other day I got the seafood lasagna and it was amazing. I bought a po boy to eat there and the lasagna to go. So as I'm leaving the cook says I hope it makes it home talking about the lasagna and I said of course it will. I had to run some errands and needles to say that final statement was on my mind and had me wondering about the lasagna so on one of my stops I said let me taste it. Well it didn't make it home, that seafood lasagna was phenomenal.  5-11-17 This review is just based off today. The food tasted good and it came out in a reasonable amount of time and the service was great but the sandwich that I received today was unacceptable. They gave me this small piece of fish and made a sandwich out of it. I will post a pic but I was pissed.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small piece of flounder to make a sandwich with I was so pissed. $9

xX9ZPlwUATvqgiFITLsqQQ.text: We had the shrimp po boy, clam chowder and mahi reuben. All were amazing! This place is so clean and the fish is so fresh. You can even purchase fish, shrimp and all from here as well as place an order for fish they don't have. Last year I ordered whole sardines to cook at home. Amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Po Boy and the Mahi Rueben.

rPkbZDmoN9JRFZt50O8D6g.text: This was my first visit and the food was great. It's kind of small inside but lots of 2 person tables so we didn't need to wait. I had the fish and chips and the fish was really good. The fries were not quite cooked through but it didn't take away from the meal. The portion was nice and I left full but not stuffed. My daughter had the shrimp po boy and enjoyed it. From what I saw all the sandwiches were on the messy side but everyone was talking about how good they were. I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for fresh seafood.

ZQycmWQglGjnlJS2knw5_g.text: I was hoping to catch them on a lobster roll day, but unfortunately that did not happen.  Instead I ordered the blackened catfish po-boy with fries and a cup of the corn chowder with shrimp & andouille sausage.  I was pleased with how quickly they finished my order, and although I ordered it to go, I ended up eating inside.  I will say that the soup was so amazing I wanted to order another cup.  The po-boy was amazing as well and the blackened seasoning does have a slight kick so have water on standby.  The bread was fresh and didn't get soggy with the toppings, but the fries were hard and overcooked.  I will continue to try to catch them on lobster roll day though.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Corn chowder with shrimp &amp; andouille sausage
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish po-boy blackened

8qv6tKzYHAORmR_N7ycUzA.text: Absolutely great seafood. I got the shrimp and oysters with fries and slaw. Mmmm, good!

KNeq1xMvYqfZ6LbJztqJpw.text: We found this restaurant by searching on Yelp and were intrigued by the reviews. The food was delicious. My husband and I both had swordfish and it was excellent. Service is also great. The decor is simple but clean and friendly.

NfrVvYkRpjxEc3YXzRQOLw.text: So. Much. Yum. I can't believe I've passed this market by for years without stopping in to check them out! Now that I've discovered the secret, I'm hooked... (Get it? Hooked? Sea food place? See what I did there?)   On my first visit, I stopped in for lunch because I saw on their Facebook page that the famous lobster roll was available. It was everything I'd hoped it would be and more. Overflowing with lobster. Buttery. Warm, soft bread. I could have eaten 10 of them by myself. I didn't even realize I was getting hand cut fries with the roll. They were a completely delicious surprise!   I can't wait to get back and try their other sandwiches. (Mahi banh mi has my name all over it.) Maybe even check them out for dinner. They also have an impressive case of fresh seafood to purchase and take home to cook. I'm coming back for those scallops!

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Look at those scallops!!
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good selection!
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Handcut fries come with all sandwiches

nekXzTZmFsgngWNsb5io1Q.text: Review is for the Market aspect of the business- not the restaurant. This place seems to be more of a restaurant than a market. Called to place an order of mussels, clams, scallops, squid, and snapper (each ~1.5 lb) with a 10 day lead time for pickup. They told me they can not do quantities that small (said they need an order of 10 lbs on mussels and clams). I'm unsure of which consumers they are targeting that purchase 10 pounds of seafood at once, but it is certainly not the typical household. Called another seafood market in Charlotte (over in the Ballantyne area) and they took the order no problem. UPDATE: Despite owners comment- I requested a 1.5lb of clams and mussels. Thanks for the "actually" try though :)

r6h3Xaxdt_2cBpAhKSgK8Q.text: You guys! I didn't realize they were open for dinner but they are! We just ate here tonight for dinner (they are open Tues-Sat until 8pm) and it was one LITERALLY of the best meals I've had in a while! You can bring your own bottle of wine (no corkage fee) and literally everything is 2 legit 2 quit! I cannot emphasize enough- support local businesses and this one is the best of the best when it comes to quality! Their lunches and fresh seafood are also phenom but dinner was off the chain! I hope you can tell from my exclamation point usage that I'm excited! They also have to-go items!

JWKt_dHjfQ69lQ9-2Fp4mg.text: Definitely the freshest seafood I have had in charlotte. Been here a couple times and have yet to be disappointed. Po boys are amazing and their fries are delicious. Always leave this place full and wishing I could eat more. Crab cakes had a decent amount of filler but being from the DC area where I am used to Maryland crab cakes I can be somewhat picky. The staff here is always extremely nice when you walk through the door and food comes out in a timely manner. The place is clean and well kept.

Gw7tPuZU3jUzhXbdyHXUeA.text: Was in the area and looked up places to eat and this popped up. I'm glad it did! Got the crab cake salad to go and a fried flounder sandwich. The crabcake was huge and absolutely scrumptious!!! The flounder sandwich was good but a little of salt would have made it delicious! I definitely want to try some of their dinner items so I'll be back!

G9NEg4YLkDqcDSvtACznVA.text: I've worked hard all week and eating on the fly.  I purposely drove 15 miles to this restaurant to enjoy a dining experience. Didn't know they close at 8 pm- early for a Friday. So before I even tasted my food. I can tell you that I came towards the end of the night albeit close to closing I asked if they were still open for business I was told they were my food was prepared in a to go bag. When asked why it was prepared to go a lot of excuses rather than correcting the unwelcoming error. SMH. I was told this is good food but to me it was served on a rusty platter.   #customerservicematters!

7JJ05tRXSyG7BbUJiPhh3w.text: I loved the food and staff was very friendly  Went there on a weekday and it was great not a local in the state just visiting friends and they recommend that we try it and I was glad

gtG5_jpl_JmFbwZYt9hzuQ.text: Got tuna tacos (taco Tuesday :) Tuna overcooked and not much flavor. French fries exact opposite - nearly raw. I'd be willing to give a second chance, just with another menu item.

GJZ2KsjsFpRjCltDXHihWg.text: Searching for something good we came across Deep Sea. I saw so many posts about the lobster roll, I was hoping it would be served and I was in luck!  The service was fast and friendly and I love the simple decor efficient includes lots of pictures of people fishing and a shelf full of records (nostalgia set in quickly).   We were there for lunch and there's a separate menu from dinner. The lobster roll war served with thick cut fries but not many were in the order and they were a bit underdone and lacking seasoning (zero salt was added).   But the lobster roll. The roll was AMAZING!!  It wasn't minced pieces of meat, it was full chunks of lobster. There was so much butter on the bread that it was running out (what's better with lobster than butter??!!). So. Good.   The hubs enjoyed the fish and chips (with the exception of the fries).  The fish we seasoned and fried well. It wasn't a large serving but it was satisfying.   The fresh seafood in the display case looked great and if we were locals we'd definitely shop there regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster roll was SO good- buttery and meaty!

toMmrHnZkj5NoeHji8Thlw.text: Really bizarre dining experience here today. We came to this restaurant about two years ago and LOVED IT...went back today and will never return. First of all the waiter was very unfriendly to the point where that alone was about to be enough to have us leave. Then I saw him handle raw fish without gloves and that's where I drew the line. I'm very sad to see an establishment like this draw a negative experience from seafood lovers like us, but it's True.   Lastly, they have a lot of condescendingly rude comments posted all over the store that are meant to be direction about how they would like you to act while dining there, but if you cannot even follow basic food safety protocol and look people in the eye...keep your snide comments to yourself.

YlqlERWPFORErowA-wWX3Q.text: Amazing lunch spot, amazing fresh fish! I don't give out 5 stars very often (especially for seafood places), but this place is awesome! Their selection of fresh fish is amazing and varied and very fresh. Their lunch menu changes every day based on what's available, but some things you can find most days (shrimp po boy, fish and chips etc...). I had the fish and chips today and it was some of the best I've ever had. I've spent a lot of time in Alaska, and I grew up in the Pacific Northwest so my seafood standards are pretty high and Deep Sea exceeded all expectations. We also tried the alligator sausage po boy and it was incredible as well. This is now a regular spot for us, both for lunch and where we buy our seafood. Bonus: they can order pretty much anything you could want, so this is a great place to use if you are trying something new or special.  Also: the employees here are TOP NOTCH. They are knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. While we were eating lunch, an employee noticed another customer had left their purse and he ran out to her car to make sure she didn't leave it. They also know several of their customers by name which speaks to their kindness and to the fact that so many people come here regularly.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States

S6_6z2D8Xcmh_gz7jNkovw.text: While staying in Charlotte on vacation, we Yelped for dinner recommendations. We wanted seafood and this Strip Mall Market came up. Located in a neighborhood outside the hub of busy Charlotte, It looks like nothing from the street. Inside a big seafood case takes up half the width of the room. 10 wooden tables and chairs take up most of the remaining space. Don't judge a book by its cover! If you like seafood, this is just the place for you! Although it was a small menu, we found some of our favorites to choose from. My husband enjoyed a fried shrimp and oyster platter fried just right while I had a creamy clam chowder and shrimp cocktail. The soup, if you like spicy, had a little kick to it. The shrimp were prepared perfectly. The orders came out very quickly. The service was great! If we lived in the area we would certainly return.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Jumbo Shrimp and Oyster Platter
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. New England Clam Chowder

ZKA8vY_o4cAllcZXgw5VPw.text: First time here, and there will be many return trips. To start, a 98 health score such as theirs is always a plus. This place is truly clean as a whistle. They have the very best crushed ice, and even their unsweetened tea was excellent. All too often, many restaurants have horrible unsweetened tea - tasting like mop water - NOT THIS RESTAURANT!!!  Hubby had an alligator sausage po-boy along with some of the best fries ever.  I had the zesty lime shrimp avocado salad, which is so fresh and delicious andcomes with a lime-juice sauce. The seafood case had a lot of excellent looking items. The cashier was super nice and helpful.   10/18/2018:  As usual, food is excellent and unsweetened tea just as good as it always is. Today, the seared tuna sandwich was an excellent choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gentleman at the register was super friendly and helpful. That seafood case has some awesome looking items.
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Alligator sausage po-boy with some very good fries.

xJKv8sQBJCWrcgKgaYsZ_Q.text: The Deep Seafood Market was definitely a great experience. When I first walked in I noticed the market aspect of the name. This place actually sells fresh raw fish. I went to the waited in line, ordered a shrimp po'boy. My food and water was brought out to me.   The customer service here was nothing short of outstanding. The guy working the register was very helpful for food recommendations (as I did not know what exactly I wanted) and was very attentive.   The food tasted wonderful. I enjoyed my shrimp po'boy. The sauce on it was made in house and was very tasty. The steak cut fries were really good. I definitely would recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of restaurant
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp po&#39;boy
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño cornbread

Lq_DllzqEYyJD16uUDuGfw.text: Lobster Rolls ! Yes please ! Today's email got me thinking that I could actually eat dinner and taste those delicious rolls for myself! And yes that's just what we did !  I had the lobster roll with potato wedges and my hubs had the Scottish Salmon dinner with zucchini & potatoes.  My lobster roll was every bite delicious. Filled with lobster and lightly buttered on a toasted roll it was yummy!  The hubs salmon was huge ! It was grilled to perfection and had a light ginger sauce with scallions.  The zucchini and potatoes were delicious!  I've read the reviews and waited for this day and it was definitely worth it!   I did have a bit of anxiety when I read the sign posted on the wall that stated any party of 2 sitting at a table of 4 could be asked to move.  Kinda made me feel like the soup nazi ... we decided not to press our luck and sat at the smaller table.  A delicious dinner that was everything I hoped it would be.  Definitely will come back .... hopefully on Lobster roll day !

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster roll
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon dinner

kXJFAvMAC5dlTDsBJcDItw.text: Best corn chowder I have ever had! The grouper was fresh and tasty!! Hubby had shrimp poboy and said it's excellent!!!

3ZJPtQScbbG42xcyKjDeog.text: Wanted to try this local place for a while and based on the reviews, we felt pretty good about having a great meal. Unfortunately, not so much. We had 5 people in our party and the Market was very accommodating but the food didn't hit the mark. Two Shrimp Po Boy's were both over cooked with coating crackling off the shrimp. I had Fish and Chips, fries were burnt, dry and tasteless. The coating was not in proportion to the cod - hardly any fish in there as I was served 4 chunks of cod instead of a nice filet where I could actually taste the fish. My wife had Shrimp tacos w/ mango salsa. Usually a good combo, but not tonight. More mush than flavor. The last dish was corn chowder with Andouille sausage - I fear the best flavor of the night - weird - no seafood in there!  Disappointed overall!!

MK99aafAmgO2Smse-MPyQQ.text: The day has finally come! Lobster Rolls are in season, Omg I can barely contain myself. You know how you can tell if a restaurant is 5-star worthy? If you see the email alert for lunch and you drive 30 minutes out of your way to go get some lobster! Yeah, I'd say that qualifies.  Late lunch, the staff already knew what I wanted when I walked in the door. I've been asking about 'em for months now. I was a bit afraid that everyone else's rave reviews of these rolls were hyping them up too much. My order arrived at the table and I was in awe. Just look at my picture and you'll get the gist. Connecticut Style Lobster served with butter, lemon, and herbs, that's it!  Was it worth it? After two past failures at other places that supposedly specializes in lobster Rolls, this one was the read deal. A generous amount of lobster in every bite, herbs and lemon was just enough to amp the lobster flavor, toasted bun. It was just, blissful! No more words, just go and get one!  Come in and sign up for their email alerts to know what the lunch specials will be daily. You won't leave disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Time for tuna!
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s so on.
Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jalapeño Cornbread only 99 cent!

uFFhlHVfoLLAQLa7NvWUwQ.text: Stopped in for lunch. Asked how things worked. They handed some a menu. I saw shrimp tacos on the menu but no fish.  I asked can I get a fish taco. He said yeah and rang it up. Guess what. I got shrimp tacos. When the waiter when back and said something I got a dirty look from the owner and was then told they only do things on the menu. Funny how I asked for fish tacos and got shrimp Ana wasn't told no. Also the shrimp tacos are steamed and not friend. They were tasty but I dint like the texture of the steamed shrimp.

7P_bqJGfA3zyQiAeBYIMbA.text: Driving through Charlotte looked up seafood and this place popped up. Was excited to try them since I was hungry for some fish.  Ordered the Mahi Bahi Mi sandwich. Fish was cooked perfectly and I knew it was fresh, the bun was soft, great texture.  Had a little spice to the bite. Yum!  Hubby had fish and chips. I thought the cod was good he didn't taste anything special. The chips neither of us liked. Over cooked flavorless.  I would definitely come again if we are traveling through Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Bahi Mi Sandwich

XY2z6x-0jj6MEbTCH1yCLw.text: Excellent fresh seafood selection and they will cook anything behind the counter for you. Had the fried oyster po-boy and it was fantastic. Only downside is they close at 5:00 and miss the dinner hour.

Wb1V0iqWXwajEBey4ZDehA.text: After reading the reviews I was expecting a delicious lunch. Sadly I was not overly impressed. I had the fish and chips. The breading on the fish was a heavy cornmeal. It was undercooked and grossly under seasoned. The french fries were ok. To their credit they were hand cut. But they were so thick that they turned out mushy. On a happy note the service was excellent.

ePic-6Rpg3PrADDyRL2FTQ.text: I have to agree with others that say the man at the register could take a lesson in customer service!  Not the friendliest or a welcoming.  It was my first visit, and that was disappointing.  However, the young man that brought me my food and bussed the tables around me was so helpful and friendly that helped to make up for my first impressions. I ordered my shrimp sandwich with no tomato, and it came with tomato. The shrimp tasted fresh and had a good breading. The bread was just OK, and the fries looked like they were going to be really good, but were a little disappointing.  It's quite a drive from my house in North Charlotte, probably wouldn't make the trek back down there specifically for this location.   Po Boys Seafood, on Freedom has a way better selection and super friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Poboy

-eHzZitZqYf4OKyapWqrAw.text: I don't write many reviews but HOLY MOLY I had to give this place props!  I googled "best lobster rolls in Charlotte" and this place popped up #1.  Sadly the rolls are not on the menu daily (not today) but I love that the menu rotates so there is always something new to try.  I opted for the salmon burger (suggested by the friendly fella behind the register).  Best. Salmon. Burger. of my life!!  Perfectly grilled and had a lovely wasabi aioli (not overpowering).  The accompanying steak fries were delish as well.  If I could give this place 10 stars I would.  I will definitely be back next Friday to try the coveted lobster rolls!!  :)

q6w5oaNt5v7q_YcRMPUEaw.text: We went today to order takeout, the gentleman was very courteous and patient. We couldnt decide on what to get. It smelled delicious, and did not have a fishy smell in the restaurant. You can order off the menu or fish to take home and cook. The food was fresh and good flavor

eOsmb_dCkdUBHxkxwNmN2Q.text: BEST SEAFOOD IN MATTHEWS!  I love this place. The atmosphere and staff are very welcoming and I feel as though I am being greeted by my long lost cousin who has had a change of heart. I placed a takeout order and got there just before they closed to pick it up... the shrimp po boy was my choice because I've never been let down by that dish.  I paid for my order then left, wanting to tip them with any extra money I had, the setup was nice in the place: the counter was wide and open, and the kitchen window was to the left (if you are facing the counter), which reminded me of a drive thru. Hahaha pretty funny, I have plenty of jokes. Actually that one wasn't my best but you get the point.  When I left, I opened up the package and got a beautiful shrimp po boy with some sauce drizzled inside, along with lettuce and fries. Every bite I took sent me on a Flavertown vacation, street cred to Guy Fieri. I will DEFINITELY be back here, I just love this place. It was reasonably priced too, about $11, so I feel it was a good meal and was worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Po Boy, right here.

dYI87hvsFSnFh7tnH7jJ-A.text: I had the mahi mahi, which was pretty good but nothing special. There wasn't enough flavor in the fish, but it was okay. The fries were okay as well. The seafood store itself seems fairly standard, but why pay almost 2x for the same fish that you could get at Costco?

ze5Igd6zKlXDh8AiNQ_i9A.text: This place is outstanding! I've tried everything on the menu, which changes seasonally, and have never been disappointed. The waitress (Gina) makes every visit a pleasure!

UAMPhxfsRT584imhmyPolA.text: Hubs and I love this place! Wish their lunch hours extended into dinner.  My favs include tuna sandwich and grouper sandwich.  Everything is always fresh and delicious

EzMfKZ_aadHqqN0pcIVeNg.text: I've finally found fresh seafood in the Charlotte area!!!   The NC trout was delicious.  Great price, too.  Keep on bringing in the catch.

B5G8SYbQ4e--3BBWzeF0qQ.text: I am a new and loyal customer of Deep Sea Seafood Market which is excellent place to grab lunch or stock up on a wide assortment of fresh seafood.  I recommend the salmon and mahi.  Not only is it the best seafood around but the prices rival grocery stores like Harris Teeter.  The owner is very helpful and can even special order specific seafoods for you (live lobster!).  Even if you live in a different part of Charlotte- TRY THIS PLACE OUT!!!

1Fee3EdCCBQ2tbC95Cacsw.text: I have only eaten there a few times but the food is Great. The fish is fresh and tasty and there lunch menu is reasonably priced. The service is excellent as well. I think its family owned and operated so its always a familiar face.

j4bX-zBKD-wjChtLDqNzlA.text: Have been here three times for lunch and it gets better every time. Amazingly fresh and high grade seafood not to mention complex and delicious food every time. Will be my go to place from now on.

IIM2yWq8gYReflKZvQkOBg.text: As a San Francisco native and world traveler this is the best seafood restaurant I have found since living in Charlotte the slaw is not to be missed ! The owner Larry and his wife Tracy have a jewel here ! Great atmosphere pleasant warm and inviting. Don't miss This place ! Will be back many times

zVREKNFhCgoKZnO5Ts4thQ.text: First time there, food was good. I had the shrimp po-boy.   Will definetley go back.  The food was very fresh...

TYsQR8vFCZHc71IBh3QTiQ.text: Freshest seafood in the area. Nicest people, always helpful. Really good gaspacho and soups.

4DNf5PMuE6v5OssWOKmscg.text: Stopped in yesterday for lunch. The place was exceptionally clean and had a friendly staff. You order at the counter, have a seat, and they will bring the food out to you.  Hand-cut fries were good, and they accompany the lunch items. There are printed lunch menus (updated daily) with lots of selections. I had the tuna tacos, which came with a fruit/cilantro salsa that was great.  Great location, easy parking. I'll be back!

C5oo3uo8HdJlHXQIDCKkMw.text: Expensive but it's charlotte--no competition.  Always consistent always good.  We buy oysters annually!

ErAkqJeEmhv52-2h1eYJ7A.text: I was excited to have lunch at DSSM. I ordered the grouper sandwich. The fish was very small and didn't cover half the bread. It didn't have much flavor. The fries that came along with them were over cooked and flavorless. I wasn't offered a choice of fries or slaw or I wouldn't have even had them. I paid $11 for half a piece of fish, a bun, and crappy french fries. The service was ok. The people working seemed like they didn't care if I were there or not but said the appropriate hellos and how was your food type things. I will definitely give it another try and order some thing else.

KQThC_3ZEYziapw_1IEvGw.text: My husband and I frequently meet for lunch at Deep Sea. Both the service and the food are excellent. I love that they have a few core menu items and then a few daily specials. The sweet tea is the best I've ever had.

Mwu2WbJ0dBYERRDWLzW-0w.text: It's hard to find a place that has fresh seafood in the Charlotte area.  I'm not sure I would recommend this place. The food is alright but the owner's attitude is awful. He's rude and gruff. Someone needs to let him know that if you're going to run a business in the South it's best to lose the yankee attitude.  Thankfully the guy that was the server was incredibly nice. If it wasn't for him I'm not sure I'd ever go back. Having good food is nice but good food isn't worth being treated badly as a customer. I had fish and chips which I thought would be a simple dish to try for a first time trip. The fish was fresh no doubt. The fries were over cooked and not that great at all.  Not sure I'll go back there.

Xtm3wAFZBoUXN_l4X8NbOw.text: I love how fresh everything is. I have tried several of their lunch items and have been very pleased. Their fried flounder is delicious. Their fried fish sandwich comes with coleslaw and a side of fries and it is wonderful. I haven't taken any fresh fish home to make at home.

fC5gh3iCUJ1nlfjMLoBPlg.text: The first time I went to here was just to pick up some fresh fish. I wanted to back for some prepared food.  So glad that we went back for lunch and had amazing food and service.  The lobster mac and cheese was so good and a huge portion.  The mahi rueben basically melts in your mouth and the oyster shooters were a delicious appetizer. Also we took some amazing Scottish salmon to cook at home

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wonderful lunch today! Delicious lobster mac and cheese and mahi reuben!!Service was awesome and fish is always amazing there!

EhY1Piu45M-gooAObNtfeg.text: I don't really get why people are so jazzed about this place. I think it's pretty mediocre. If you love cilantro, it's in a lot of the stuff. If not, it permeates a lot of dishes. The fish and chips were extremely mediocre. My mom ordered a banh mi without cilantro and it still had a strong cilantro taste. Attitude of the staff isn't great. Seemed annoyed when we were ordering. Pretty sad this is the "best" people can get when it comes to seafood in Charlotte.

s5WktKzx5cgKKzy2a65Umw.text: LOVE this place! I'm lucky enough to work in the same plaza so I'm a frequent customer, and as a New England transplant, I can honestly say Deep Sea does it right! The blackened catfish po boy is killer, and highly recommend the corn chowder with shrimp and sausage when they have it. To die for! Everything I've ever ordered has been fresh and delicious. Thank you Larry for bringing a True taste of home here to Charlotte!

nI2ZZyGBfGJbnI6riWVFhg.text: Delicious!  I never noticed this place before. It's next door to the UPS store and I saw the big sign in the window that they serve lunch, in addition to selling fresh fish.   First, the place does not have that awful fishy smell that knocks you off your feet at most fish vendors. It's clean and cheery. Order your lunch at the counter and they bring it to your table.  Or get your lunch order to go.   I had the halibut fish tacos which were nicely spiced and flavorful.  The tacos came with big, fat fries. And I ordered unsweet tea. The tea came with a nice wedge of lemon without having to ask.  I will be back for lunch another day now that I've found this little gem in Matthews.

VzEtUMW3cfJSMX7ZpZS_9w.text: Popped in for lunch today, wonderful experience! Staff was friendly, didn't have to wait long for my food, and my crab cake sandwich (and fries) were flavorful and perfectly cooked! 5 out of 5 stars! Delicious!

39hMczuf0beQbH7o8kjPmw.text: This place is always good. Food is consistent and the service is great. Nice small independent operation. They always change their lunch specials, so it's a good idea to get on their email list. My only gripe is that they only serve cooked food from 11 a.m. until 2 p.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Mahi Bahn Mi sandwich!

Ki8gA-WmVsnaxhwWcDUIKQ.text: A great place to visit for fresh seafood. Has a very casual feel supported by a plethora of nice folk who visit often. I would recommend the fish tacos for lunch and to try the lime slaw.

Quw3lQUdCD2XBn-TzbfOVg.text: I came here for dinner last night based on the high Yelp rating and close proximity to my hotel and had awesome crab cake dinner with peach salsa and smashed potatoes. All wonderfun!!  Meaty crab cakes,  little to no filler or binder, with  tasty homemade remulade and cocktail sauce.  The smashed potatoes were a surprise hit.  Didn't expect much but wow!  Buttery, sour creamy, tasty!  And I liked the sweet and spicy kick from the peach salsa.  That meal was so good I encouraged my coworker- friend from to eat here for lunch.  He had the Mahi Reuben sandwich and a side of slaw.  He loved the sandwich.  I tried the slaw and it was bright, lightly creamy and crunchy - so good! There's some lime or something in there that really separates it from your typical Cole slaw.  And I had the seared Ahi tuna with Applewood bacon and spicy slaw on a chibatta bun.  Wow!!  If you like seared FRESH Ahi as an appetizer, you won't believe what a great it is to have it for lunch.  I also enjoyed the corn chowder and jalapeno cornbread. The soup was just the right amount of creamy to meaty ratio.  The cornbread was fresh and moist with crispy edges the way you'd expect from a place that seems to do everything with a high level of attention to detail, balance of flavors and perfect execution. I wanted to try everything I could because I leave Charlotte tomorrow.   I'll be back!!  Thanks guys!!

HlmgSeeEkqlkuCK31x681w.text: We bought seafood here for about a year before we tried the food, the groceries are always fresh, never frozen. Their quality standards are unbeatable. I usually find tilapia mealy and gross, but we bought some from Deep Sea to make our little girl some homemade fish sticks (she likes to help), and it was firm, flaky and delicious. I tested it several times against Harris Teeter since and it is seriously just better. ...then we tried the food. Now we eat here regularly and usually take home some bacon-wrapped jalapenos or crab cakes. The soups they make are CRAZY good, you can buy those to go too. The grouper sandwich is usually on the menu, which changes with what's available, and it is my favorite. Everything we have ever tried at Deep Sea is done very well or better. There is always a line for lunch, and for good reason... this place is a GEM!

oDnSE8cWlTv3Zy0UW5Ocsw.text: Went here for dinner with my family and it was amazing! Have never had fresher seafood anywhere in Charlotte. Come try it! You won't be disappointed. Everything is homemade and family run. Met the owners and they take great pride in making fresh and really tasty food :)

nZZ606fhBQccbXfox7E41w.text: After reading several Yelp reviews I decided to finally find and try Deep Sea. I would probably never notice this place if I were to drive by it on a normal day being that it is in a small strip mall. The place is pretty simple but I don't mind the ambience as long as the food is good. The menu is not the same as the lunch menu and they have rotating specials so I highly suggest you call the restaurant before visiting. I kept asking for lunch items I saw on Yelp and they were not available for dinner. Bummer but I was ok with it. The menu is not overly complicated where you cannot choose what to eat but there is plenty of options. I had the pan seared tuna sandwich with fries. The sandwich was amazing, a little spicy due to the slaw that comes on the sandwich but still enjoyable. The portion was more than enough for me. I wish this place was closer to my job so that I can try the lunch menu but I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seared Tuna sandwich

04a5zfxRIbWHlYMvoZwOHA.text: I'm not sure what the hype is about but the food my boyfriend and I ordered was fresh but bland. I didn't like the fries (chips). Average service. Don't know if I want to give it another shot by trying something else. The pictures I've seen posted look good. Maybe they have improved since we went. Otherwise might be worth buying some fresh and cooking yourself at home. Fish and chips a definite no.

O4f-eO_XsSRQ9Tlcp36rpA.text: I love this place, I go here for lunch twice a week they prepare everything fresh,friendly staff the waitress she is so nice with the best service anyone wants, My two favorite sandwich are the mahi mahi and the grouper with chipotle sauce on the side YUM!YUM! make sure you ask them to give you chipotle sauce it has a little kick to it but delicious goes very well on the sandwich and potato wedges :)

KCBgRRbaDBsleoPaZ8Demg.text: Had the seared tuna sandwich and slaw.  Both outstanding.   Seared tuna platter also perfectly prepared.  Bring your own wine or beer and your all set

ixM5NFOYGsTQZ5PBo-_rSQ.text: I've been into Deep Sea a handful of times since they opened - mostly to get seafood to go. They truly have the freshest selection - yes the prices are higher than HT, but this is FRESH seafood. On my last visit I picked up some wild caught gulf jumbo shrimp - they were ginormous! Nothing like what you find at the grocery store.   I've heard great things about their clam bakes/lobster dinners - I have to check one out soon!

xEstAWNxIi_6AfLKIq9NHw.text: What a find for dinner! Started with a New England clam chowder that was right on the money. Perfectly prepared super fresh trout and redfish made for a terrific meal. Hard to find seafood at fair prices and with good service.

tsxv3a2BN0F7vbb5XGdZuA.text: Really good food, fresh seafood not the friendliest staff but the food is good. Very clean , great lobsta roll.

8dwMUXFvJ-BvLd86fiFazA.text: I don't think I have ever had a bad meal here. This place is definitely hidden and unless you are looking, you'll drive right by. The menu changes daily but my go to is always always (yep.. two always  :) ) the seared tuna and applewood smoked bacon sandwich.. Mmmm so good! The steak fries are just ok as they are never fully cooked on the inside but this place is worth it. Everything is made to order and as you order and seating is limited so get there early to be beat the rush..

xcR3Vmerf8-KW-nZ8X8SVQ.text: One of my absolute favorite places to eat lunch. Tucked away in a nondescript shopping strip in Matthews right past the Food Lion on Monroe Road is this fantastic seafood shoppe and lunch/dinner establishment. Not only can you buy from a wonderful and varied selection of the freshest seafood for your own grilling and cooking needs, but also stop in and just nosh for lunch and dinner when you don't feel like cooking and still eat some of the best seafood dishes in town. Of note are the wonderful lobster rolls (if there are any left), fresh seafood salads, smoked salmon BLT, mahi reuben and a host of other seafood offerings that are rotated in and out of the daily menu. They have started offering dinner as well so anyone in the area should for sure give them a chance. They are family owned and operated and always offer the best quality!

EqtzqtbUcl1SRZOgfl-ryw.text: This is my go to lunch spot if I have a customer in town who wants really good food chowder is awesome  love it every time Lobster roll is great $$ but worth it  Great Job Larry

wvYGcNVsfsC0hYRymvNUvw.text: Decided to try "Deep Sea" on Monroe Rd for lunch today. When I try a place for the first time, I usually order something basic, since theoretically, I know what to expect. So I ordered the fried flounder sandwich.  Friendly, courteous staff. Prompt service. Everything was fresh and tasty. But the main ingredient was almost missing. Sandwich was about 90% bread with a very tiny sliver of flounder in it. Unimpressed.  If you want a fried flounder sandwich, I recommend Showmars.

Hr3MGBEVpcOsCFW9hLPRDg.text: The best seafood market in town , little high but worth it , fried shrimp po boy is crazy good , the only thing The Owner operating this place is a very rude and has a attitude that he's doesn't care if you don't  come back ,  Good seafood , Reasonable prices , Dickhead owner,

reU092AHb7WEc3Zd2ufDCQ.text: Best seafood lunch in town. Very little fried. Everything on menu is great. Blacken grouper sandwich is the best.

vziqqZSLzfkdD4AfJG5RWQ.text: 2 years later and it's still excellent and I am still getting to the blackened grouper sandwich.

XMxK6hHsdQhOvwYbf0qp1g.text: Very good fresh food and service. These guys are a go to for fresh seafood! Love the shrimp stuffed jalapenos!

byvHazWVPZcSC89Li9ocIw.text: Six month later and this is still the ONLY place for lunch around here (IMHO) Service can be slow, they run out of items at times, yet instead of cutting corners this foodie couple who runs Deep Sea strives to make the food better, tastier. And succeeds: the new grilled tuna sandwich w/ artichoke roasted pepper compote & rosemary basil aioli kicks @ss! 5 star, really. Now they'll start using "micro greens"? Helen Shwab did a write up on them : charlotteobserver.com/20... they've been slammed since I saw that half a dozen favorable were "filtered", I doubt they were fakes.

PWyDHx5icWnLKgTkb4EcUg.text: Fast friendly service! Fresh seafood and delicious sandwiches. Menu changes daily but you will not be disappointed. There's something delicious for everyone. I had the alligator sausage po boy! Juicy smokey deliciousness! I will return!

ey8bMRk4vbia9WigTVXKIg.text: Very small place and limited seating. The location is tucked away. I would like to see this restaurant expand. I believe they have a very special menu and the blue crab tasted great. It was our first time trying this. The servers were pleasant. I wish they had a wine list. That would have complemented the seafood well

photos.caption: Photo of Deep Sea Seafood Market - Charlotte, NC, United States. Soft Shell Blue Crab Sandwich with Fresh House Steak Fries. Was good! Will be out of season verryy soon

pZ-8f2SBK-CQFyt8j92IuQ.text: We came in for lunch and the food was great! I had the blue crab stuffed avocado salad; it was wonderful!  My husband had the tuna and bacon sandwich. He left nothing on his plate.  We will be coming back here for sure!

wHBd2txmDlsEnXD-PeC1wQ.text: Best seafood we had on our trip.  My seared tuna BLT was excellent.  Great little spot for lunch!
